description.narrative: Landscape approach to management of peatlands aiming at multiple ecological benefits
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: To promote a landscape approach to management of peatlands so as to conserve biodiversity, enhance carbon stocks, and secure multiple ecosystem services with demonstration in the Poozerie landscape.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Landscape approach to peatlands conservation and sustainable use enshrined in national policy and implemented through a network of PAs in the Poozerie landscape
Increase in local hunter association income from sustainable hunting

comment.narrative: Increase in revenue from sustainable hunting estimated at 2500 per year per site
Assesment of financial incomes by local hunter association as result of undertaken activities wil be conducted in 20152017 for the pilot projects territories reserves Nalibokski and Zvanets

description.narrative: Increase in local tourism organization income from wildlife viewing

comment.narrative: Approx 1200
Increase in revenue from wildlife viewers estimated at 5000 per year at all pilots
Assesment of financial incomes as result of undertaken activities wil be conducted in 20152017 for the pilot projects territories reserves Nalibokski and Zvanets

description.narrative: A network of local caretakers is operational in the internationally important peatland PAs

comment.narrative: At present system of local caretakers are in 8 important peatland PAs
Network exists for 18 internationally important peatland PAs by Year 3

Activities are planned for 20152016 In 2015 an agreement with a leading national NGO in this area Akhova ptushak Batskaushchyny was reached and preliminar financial and working plan was worked out In September 2015 official agreement on implementation of this activity will be signed It presumes using of NIM modality

description.narrative: Flow of polluted waters from drainage areas into nearby natural water bodies

comment.narrative: Baseline level of pollutant flow to be measured in first quarter of project
Decrease in pollutants from baseline levels by 50 by Year 4 which creates conditions for the restoration of biodiversity
The project is developed and passing through state ecological expertise Project is expected to be implemented by December 2015

description.narrative: Criteria and methodologies for assessment of peatlands state function and services

comment.narrative: Criteria exist but they only take into account economic benefits
Criteria and methodology developed by Year 2 and includes ecological criteria in the form of recommendations instructions
A technical code on criteria including ecological ones for peatlands use developed and duly approved by Ministry of Environemnt on f June 26th 2015 1712082015 33140

description.narrative: Emission reductions through rewetting of disturbed areas in Yelnya PA see table on carbon benefits below for details

comment.narrative: In the baseline scenario emissions reduction would be 0 tCO2equ
Target emission reduction over 20 years 54562420 tCO2equ

Contract is under implementation for assessment of emission in Yelnya before completion of works on restoration of hydrological regime In 2016 similar studies will be conducted to assess changes in GHG fluxes after rewetting

description.narrative: A network of environmental corridors in the Vitebsk Oblast Poozerie landscape ensuring the continuity of the natural landscapes and unrestricted wildlife migration

comment.narrative: Isolated elements of the network are in place which are not considered in territorial planning
An environmental network is developed comprised of the key territories and environmental corridors linking bogs and wet areas together by Year 3
Environmental Network for Vitebsk Oblast Poozerie was established and duly approved be the Ministry of Environment and Vitebsk Regional Executive Committee

description.narrative: Crosssectoral WG for promoting a landscape approach to peatlands conservation and sustainable use

comment.narrative: None exists at present
Working Group formed by Year 1 and receives capacity building support from partner international peatland conservation organizations
Another two meetings of the Working Group took place in November 2014 and February 2015 where main provisions of the Strategy and Schemes were approved

description.narrative: National Strategy for Peatlands

comment.narrative: Old Scheme ended in 2010 and emphasis was on peat mining and agriculture
New 20year strategy that takes economic and ecological benefits into account in determining use of peatlands by Year 4

Strategy for sustainable use of peatlands until 2030 and Schemes of peatland distribution with instructions on the use of peatlands are developed and being reviewed Final documents are expected by December 2015

description.narrative: Inventory of all peatlands

comment.narrative: Outdated listing of peatlands exist and it is spotty not comprehensive
Current and comprehensive listing of peatlands status functions services based on above criteria by Year 3
Inventories of peatlands in three MInsk Brest and Vitebsk out of six target regions completed Inventory of remaining peatlands shall be completed by end of 2015

description.narrative: Plans for restoration of hydrological regime in the Yelnya peatland PA are elaborated and implemented

comment.narrative: Plan for Yelnya at the stage of elaboration but not finished and not implemented
Plans are elaborated and implemented by Year 4
The project is developed and passing through state ecological expertise Hydroregime is expected to be restored by December 2015

description.narrative: Enhanced management effectiveness at planned local reserves as measured by METT local reserves have been clustered in to 3 groups based on geographical location

comment.narrative:
Vitebsk Poozerie Cluster Krasniy Moch Uzgon Bolshoy Moch Potoki Lebediny Moch Zaborovski Moch Rossonski Moch 6
Eastern Cluster Esmonovski Moch Ushlovskoe Yasen Velikiy Ostrov Oster Beloe 6
Central Cluster Ushanskoe Chertovo boloto Surazhinskoe TurshevkaChertovo Ositskoe 6
Each of the 3 clusters 42
Management effectiveness will be evaluated after protected areas establishment in NovemberDecember 2015

description.narrative: Enhanced management effectiveness at existing PAs as measured by METT

comment.narrative:
Yelnya 48
Morochno 20

Yelnya 60
Morochno 45
METT assessment is planned for 20152016 after completion of works on restoration of hydrological regime in Yelnya and development of the management plan for Morochno

description.narrative: Restoration and management of degraded agricultural and forested peatlands for improved biodiversity conservation sustainable land management and carbon sequestration within landscapes
Water levels at rewetted forest peatlands F3 pilots

comment.narrative: 4080 cm below soil
030 cm below soil
Measurements will be conducted in 20152017 after completion of respective construction works at 3384 ha

description.narrative: Water levels at rewetted agricultural peatlands F1 pilots

comment.narrative: 60 cm and more below soil
10 to 30 cm except for Mgle and Yurievo where target is 0 to 40 cm
Measurements will be conducted in 20152017 after completion of respective construction works at 3455 ha

description.narrative: Revised GESTs developed covering drained and rewetted bogs for recently rewetted agricultural fens and for the transient stages

comment.narrative: Current GESTs apply only to extracted peatland areas
Gaps in GESTs are filled by Year 4 such that agricultural and forestry biotopes are covered

Continuation of twoyear monitoring of greenhouse gases fluxes agricultural on and forestry biotopes
As of of 30 June 2015 all investigated sites were recorded for GHG exchange fot 19 month
Emission of CO2 for oneyear period was 464462666 gСО2Cm2 for fen in transition stage meadow grass Phleum on drained peat soils for agricultural purposes with changed land use from cultivated crops to perennial grass meadow
emission of CO2 was 511 278 gСО2Cm2 for biotope dominated by Polytrichum commune on raised bogs with disturbed hydrological regime
Emission of CO2 was 39137 gСО2Cm2 for biotope dominated by Calluna vulgaris on raised bogs with disturbed hydrological regime
Emission of N2O was negligible only on drained bogs sites On fens in transition stage site N2O emission was 644 mgN2ON m2 for oneyear period
The CH4 emission was negligible at all sites

description.narrative: Perennial grass cover at arable peatlands that are converted to improved grassland F2 pilots

comment.narrative: More than 70 of pilot sites are arable land
100 ha of F2 sites are improved grassland
400 ha of F2 sites have been converted to improved grassland

description.narrative: Content of organic matter in soil F4 sites

comment.narrative: Organic matter in soil 5070 F4 sites
Content of organic matter in soil decreases by no more than 5
Deep ploughing of 10 hectares completed Organic matter monitoring is ongoing Results of the organic content analysis will be available in 2016

description.narrative: Improvement in biodiversity indicator species at pilot sites

comment.narrative: See baseline values for pilot sites in table below
See target values for pilot sites in table below

Biodiversity inventory at pilot sites 8 territories of over 8000 ha was completed before rewetting Flora and fauna charactiristic were recorded It was shown that for the pilot territories the most typical vegetation type is pine forests growing in an unstable hydrological regime with signs of digression Populations of birds indictor species are characterized by significant lower levels in comparison with target numbers Monitoring works will continue in 20152017 after rewetting

description.narrative: Reduction in GHG emissions and enhanced carbon sequestration at pilot sites

comment.narrative: See baseline values for pilot sites in table below
See target values for pilot sites in table below

Respective assessments for sites of agriculture lands completed before rewetting 3455 ha Total GHG emissions before intervention 33030 тСО2 eqyear
Respective assessments for other sites forested peatlands completed in 20142015 before rewetting for 3384 ha Total GHG emissions before intervention 15031 тСО2 eqyear

description.narrative: To promote a landscape approach to management of peatlands that conserves biodiversity enhances carbon stocks ensures sustainable land management and sustainable forest management with demonstrations in a number of pilot sites peatland PAs agricultural peatlands and forested peatlands
Extent of peatland area that is brought under an effective landscapebased conservation andor sustainable use regime under the framework of a National Strategy for Peatlands NSP

comment.narrative: Currently there is no NSP there are a few disparate efforts through past and ongoing donorfunded projects to restore conserve and sustainably use peatlands

122270 ha
Of which 30301 ha are existing peatland national zakazniks where management effectiveness is improved 25036 ha are new local zakazniks 45000 ha is the network of environmental corridors 15000 ha of drainage networks on agricultural peatlands from which sedimentation is to be reduced 4311 ha are rewetted agricultural lands 495 ha are arable peatlands converted to meadows 100 ha are arable peatlands subject to layered ploughing and 2027 ha are rewetted forest peatlands

59337 ha
13927 ha reserved at the local level for establishing of 7 new reserves 25000 ha of new reserves will be officially gazzeted by end of 2016 An a network of environmental corridors covering 45000 ha established
An engineering project to establish a drainage network covering 15000 ha on agricultural peatlands developed to reduce adverse impact of anthropogenic runoffs from landreclamation systems on ecosystems of the Zvanest reserve works will be completed by mid 2016
An engineering project for rewetting of 3455 ha of agricultural lands developed 400 ha of arable peatlands converted to meadows 10 ha of arable peatlands subject to layered ploughing and engineering projects for rewetting of 3384 ha forested peatlands developed
